title: Ponytail magazine outlandish swash type, high contrast
content:
Hi,  
I'd like to find out the name of a script type with big swashes used in Issue 3 of Ponytail Magazine. Attached samples (sorry about the photos) plus more here: [http://www.ponytailmagazine.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120612000232/http:/www.ponytailmagazine.com/ "http://www.ponytailmagazine.com/")  
Thanks to all in advance,  
Henry

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120612000232im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Image044_4348.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120612000232im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Image045_5839.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120612000232im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Image046_6152.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20120612000232im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Image047_4094.jpg)
author: manofscience

comments.content:
It looks like Memoriam by Canada Type

[http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/memoriam/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120612000232/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/memoriam/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/canadatype/memoriam/")
